instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> tpad/kbd not working and questionmark folder
threads.message:
Hi, This touchbar macbook originally had liquid damage only around the <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> area. I had to run a couple wires on a resistor and capacitor due to the pads being gone on them. After that the machine turned on and everything worked fine. I sent it back to the customer and now they sent it back to me since it is showing a questionmark folder and now I don't feel the trackpad clicking and even if I hold the option key on startup nothing happens.
This isn't the first time I've fixed a machine that had liquid damage around a USB-C controller chip only to have it return back a few weeks later for a questionmark folder appearing but this one doesn't make sense to me because the only liquid damage was on the opposite side of where the SSD controller chip is.

Here are some measurements around the TPAD area that I took to find out why it's not clicking.
F4500 - 13v on both sides.
L4500 - 5v on both sides
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_TPAD</SIGNAL> - 0.08v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> tpad/kbd not working and questionmark folder
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_TPAD</SIGNAL> - 0.08v"
Check for short there, w/ and w/o trackpad flex connected.
If OK, then check continuity to <RESISTOR>R5650</RESISTOR>.
Do you get correct <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> tpad/kbd not working and questionmark folder
threads.message:
Okay I just measured for a short and yes <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> is 0v to ground in diode mode with and without the trackpad being plugged in. In voltage mode I was also getting 0v on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> but in diode mode <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> is not shorted to ground. <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is present and working fine.

Should I start injecting voltage on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> to find the short?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> tpad/kbd not working and questionmark folder
threads.message:
Yes, try that.
Remember my advices about voltage injection...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> tpad/kbd not working and questionmark folder
threads.message: I'm not sure where your advice on voltage injection is but could you let me know what you recommend for this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> tpad/kbd not working and questionmark folder
threads.message:
Always start injecting lower voltage.
Increase it, but maintain ampers bellow current limit of the power supply.
Never inject more than 120% of the nominal voltage of that power rail.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> tpad/kbd not working and questionmark folder
threads.message:
Okay I injected voltage and found that is was <CAPACITOR>C3736</CAPACITOR> that was shorted to ground. I replaced that and everything is working fine now.

Thanks!
